title: Hearing delayed for man charged in killing of Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts
text:
A hearing to determine whether key evidence can be used against a man charged in the killing of University of Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts has been delayed.

A law enforcement source close to the case told Fox News on Tuesday that the evidence against Cristhian Bahena Rivera, who is accused of murdering the 20-year-old in July 2018, is overwhelming.

The source did not explain exactly what the evidence was but it has been reported that Tibbetts' blood was found in Rivera's car trunk.

Prosecutors acknowledged last week that officers didn't read Rivera his rights during an interrogation before Tibbetts' body was recovered.

A court official says a hearing scheduled for Tuesday to decide if the information from that interrogation could be used to rebut testimony has been postponed because a defense lawyer's parent has died. It will be rescheduled.

Scroll down for video

University of Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts was killed in July 2018. She was 20

Murder suspect Cristhian Bahena Rivera claims his Miranda rights were violated. he is seen above in this file photo from a court hearing in September 2018

The 25-year-old man is scheduled for trial in February.

Prosecutors allege Rivera stalked Tibbetts while she was running near her hometown of Brooklyn, stabbed her to death and dumped her body in a cornfield.

Four weeks after Mollie disappeared while jogging, Rivera led police to her body in a cornfield, and was charged with the murder.

The case sparked a huge immigration debate after federal agents revealed Rivera was a Mexican national present in the country illegally.

Soon after Rivera's arrest, President Donald Trump brought up Mollie's murder to make the case for restricting illegal immigration and building a southern border wall.

‘You heard about today with the illegal alien coming in very sadly from Mexico and you saw what happened to that incredible, beautiful young woman,’ Trump said. 'Should have never happened. Illegally in our country.’

Mollie's father Robert Tibbetts angrily denounced the sentiment and rejected the idea that Mollie's murder should be used to justify immigration restrictions.

'The Hispanic community are Iowans,' said Robert Tibbetts, adding that he believed immigrants 'have the same values as Iowans' and are 'Iowans with better food.'

Rivera is charged with first-degree murder and is being held at Poweshiek County Jail pending a $5 million cash-only bond. He faces life in prison if convicted.

In March, he won a request to have his trial moved to Woodbury County several hundred miles away in western Iowa, on the grounds that there would be a lower proportion of white people in the jury pool there.
